segment.documentation: BGM, A segment identifying the message type, its reference, date and the identification of a reference to which the CUSRES is a response.
NAD, A segment identifying the parties relevant to the message. For example, agent, importer, etc.
LOC, A segment identifying the places relevant to the message. For example, port of entry, location of goods, etc.
DTM, A segment identifying the relevant dates and times in the message. For example, payment date, date of arrival.
GIS, A segment identifying the various customs processing indicators. For example, cargo released, cargo held, examination required, earlier message accepted or rejected, etc.
FTX, A segment stating information in unsolicited clear text.
EQD, A segment identifying equipment initials and numbers required to identify a shipment, covering the whole message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying the location and specifics of an application error condition within a message to which the CUSRES is a response.

segment.documentation: ERP, A segment identifying the location of an application error within another message.
ERC, A segment identifying the type of application errors within a message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying particular shipping or packing units reported in an earlier declaration which are now subject to customs action (examination, release, etc).

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment identifying the number and type of manifested units that are being referenced.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying markings and labels, and describing the goods related to PCI.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment identifying markings and labels on individual shipping or packing units.
FTX, A segment identifying packages, related to PCI, in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A segment identifying totals for tax, fees, and duties declared and due for payment, following the computation by customs.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying tax/duty/fee type, base and rate due for payment.
MOA, A segment identifying tax/duty/fee amounts due for payment (e.g. total tax amount).
GIS, A segment identifying an indicator related to the preceding TAX (e.g. method of payment indicator).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying a reference and/or the item taxes, fees and duties (with the associated details), following their computation by customs based on data provided by the declarant.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a particular reference.
DTM, A segment identifying a date related to the preceding RFF.
MEA, Segment identifying various measurement values where these are required for the computation of duties/taxes/fees due.
EQD, A segment identifying equipment initials and numbers required to identify a shipment related to a declaration identified in the preceding RFF.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments identifying the monetary amount, currencies and the rate of exchange against which duties, taxes or fees are being computed.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount against which any duty, tax, or fee is being computed.
CUX, A segment identifying currencies and the rate of exchange for a monetary amount identified within this group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying the customs amounts for duties, taxes and fees, following computation by customs.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying the tax/duty/fee type, rate and base for customs item amounts.
MOA, A segment identifying a tax/duty/fee amount related to the TAX.
GIS, A segment identifying an indicator related to the preceding TAX (e.g. method of payment indicator).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying documentary requirements where they are needed as supporting information for customs processing.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment identifying a document required as supporting information by customs.
DTM, A segment identifying a date related to the preceding DOC.
LOC, A segment identifying a location related to the preceding DOC.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A segment permitting the verification of the authenticity of the sender and the integrity of the data.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment containing the result of the algorithm permitting the verification of the authenticity of the sender and the integrity of the data.
DTM, A segment identifying a date associated with the preceding AUT.
